data.title: Red Alert CashTicks
data.body:
In the current OpenRA version every cash down tick is heared. Some people (including myself, my brother and brother-in-law) find this sound very annoying. Therefore I have written a patch.

This patch gives the player an option to decrease the number of heard ticks. This behavoir is more like the original game. There is also an option to disable the cash ticks at all.

Three options for cash ticks:
Extreme: current behavoir (every cash countdown tick is heard)
Normal: RedAlert countdown style (only one cash countdown tick every ~1 or 2 seconds)
Disabled: No cash tickdown or tickup is heard.

Thanks to Tirili for hints on the settings system.

data.title: To go along with introducing the 'cloaked hbox', ensure that the cloak i...
data.body: ...s disabled if at low power.

data.title: cnc - changed various unit speeds; gave increased sight to MCV and MSAM....
data.body:
MCV and MSAM vision improved to 7 and 10, respectively. MCV for early tiberium spotting and MSAM because it's artilllery with range 14.
Speed changes:  I will explain in converted speed values on "clear" terrain, since speed numbers are confusing (vehicles take a big penalty on terrain while tanks don't)
Buggy - from 7.2 to 9.6. Now the fastest unit, to encourage hit and runs behind enemy lines on lightly armored units (e.g. artillery), infantry and wood buildings. 
Bike - from 7.8 to 8.4. Bikes aren't uber fast, but they're now designed to zoom at ultra speed, way faster than anything else, once they get a road. 
Hum-vee - from 6 to 8.4 A bit slower than the buggy, with slightly more hitpoints. 
Med. Tank - from 7.2 to 5.6. I've tried differentiating the light tank and medium from one another; making medium slower is one way (they were set at identical speeds). Medium is still fast enough to break through places. Light tank has slightly less firepower (damage per second), but shoots fare more often, increasing odds of a hit.

data.title: cnc - made helicopter selection bounds a bit smaller
data.body:
Made smaller since they're so huge. So they interfere less with selection of other units next to them. 
http://i.imgur.com/3hTKt.jpg for example (orca and chinook selection bounds have been reduced in size. ignore the pip error for the chinook, it's been corrected.)

data.title: cnc - made selection bounds of helicopters a bit smaller
data.body:
made selection bounds of Chinook, Apache and Orca a bit smaller since they extend quite far beyond their typical size, and it can be problematic to select units next to them without also selecting the chopper. I reduced the size of the selection bounds just enough to make it easier to select units right beside them, but not so that they're too small for the size of the unit.
Chinook can't really go below 40 px, since that's the size required to display its 10 passenger pips.

data.title: cnc - made selection bounds of helicopters a bit smaller
data.body:
made selection bounds of Chinook, Apache and Orca a bit smaller since they extend quite far beyond their typical size, and it can be problematic to select units next to them without also selecting the chopper. I reduced the size of the selection bounds just enough to make it easier to select units right beside them, but not so that they're too small for the size of the unit.
Chinook can't really go below 40 px, since that's the size required to display its 10 passenger pips.

data.title: cnc - many weapon strength changes, some new weapon additions
data.body:
MRLS (msam) adjusted again. Fewer rockets, more damage, higher spread. 
cannons and rockets set to 100% against armor
machine gun (jeep, buggy) made stronger and with higher spread
gun turret significantly more powerful and now matches RA turret (rate of fire, damage per shot)
rifle infantry given more damage vs. light armor
many small changes here and there, including adding "piffpiff" to some guns instead of "piff"
orca AA missiles travel faster, to avoid crashing into them when firing & moving simultaneously
added new weapons for future units: TankLaser, BigChemspray, ChemScud

data.title: cnc - add new explosion: chemball
cnc - updated several building hitpoints
data.body:
sandbag and chain-link fence from 300 to 100. 
concrete wall from 1000 to 250 
nuk2 to 650 hp (prevents airstrike from killing in one shot)
airfield and weapons factory from 1000 to 1750 (prevents 1 ion cannon shot from destroying the $2000 building)

data.title: cnc - increase sight range for MCV, MSAM
bots (once again) build pillboxes. (good vers of patch)
Terrain sprites span multiple sheets
data.body:
For some reason, this error pops up at start up after I try adding and making use of a new graphic, regardless, I've tried 3-4 different SHPs and I still get the same error. By "making use of", I mean defining sequences for the SHP or using a SHP as a cameo/icon

If it helps, the mod I'm working on already has well over 200 new SHPs, and around 50-100 AUDs, as well as 4 added factions on top of the Allies and Soviet.

System.InvalidOperationException: Terrain sprites span multiple sheets

data.title: anti-air units keep shooting at crashing air units
data.body: Anything that is able to shoot at an air unit keeps on shooting at it even after the air unit's hitpoints have gone below 0 and is displaying the "crashing to the ground" animation.

data.title: Units go to close range to shoot instead of staying at range
data.body:
Issues with units not staying at range, and instead closing in unnecessarily on an enemy target. 
1) I've noticed that my units will keep approaching an enemy unit I have told to engage, stopping usually 2 squares away, even though their range is much greater (say, 4-6)
2) Often units won't begin to fire until they're about 2 squares away for some reason.

These 2 thiings often cause puts units into danger by coming unnecessarily close, and then they die.

This happens whether I attack-move them, target something directly, or leave them idle within range. 

It would be better if they:
1) don't go any closer than they have to while approaching a unit. 
2) open fire immediately upon entering range instead of waiting until they're 2 squares away

data.title: Issue with Chrono ability
data.body:
1) select a area to chono (include some buildings and units) ex silos and a tank
2) when select where to chrono to, the silos will be included in the chrono but they are red indicateing that they will not be transported. They should not be included at all because they don't have Chonospheareable trait

increase range and balance MRLS + improve APC gun damage
word wrap ingame not working
data.body: Ingame chat is cutting text, instead of word wrap.

data.title: if a selected mod is no longer available, game wont start again
data.body:
If you select a custom mod, but then the folder moves or is renamed, or if you launch a different copy of OpenRA which doesn't have it, the settings.yaml file gains the string "Mod:  " with the field blank. OpenRA won't start anymore until you remove that line.

It should not fail to boot (error msg was "System.InvalidOperationException: Sequence contains no elements
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.Aggregate[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`3 func) ), it should ask you what mod you'd like to load, or at least default to RA. I don't think that blank line "Mod: " should appear in the settings.yaml, or if it does, then that shouldn't crash it. 

I had this problem and couldn't figure out what was wrong; I uninstalled and reinstalled but it still didn't work. For someone doing modding and with several few versions installed, it is problematic.

data.title: Website: the "IRC" link at the top
data.body:
Suggest renaming the link from "IRC" to "OpenRA Chat", and having the URL be http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=openra instead of irc://chat.freenode.net/openra.

Rationale:

-Generation & nerd gap. 
a) To younger folks, esp non-nerds, the term "IRC" means absolutely nothing. 
b) Consider the "living in the web browser" phenomenon.
c) In short: "You mean it's like facebook chat, but I have to _download_ something???"

-Ease of use.
a) Folks already familiar with IRC will still be able to simply look at the URL and know where to point in their IRC client. This wont drive this group away.
b) For folks not familiar with IRC, the webchat is a quick/painless way to ease into it. This will make it more welcoming to this group.

data.title: Add sell / repair / powerdown key shortcuts to RA
data.body:
CNC has "[" for sell and "]" for repair. RA could use these keys, plus a third key for powerdown. 

If tirili's keyshortcut stuff is merged, this would be configurable?

data.title: would like infantry to "explode" conditionally: when crushed
data.body:
I would like it when chem warriors die crushed to do damage via a weapon to whoever ran them over.

Chrisf suggested: "Explodes, but filtered on the death type?"

Does this mean the functionality would go by "infdeath: x" representing the different ways you can die (shot up to ribbons, explode, light on fire, "melt", get run over, etc.), and allow those conditions to trigger any follow-ups to be programmed?
